author: Special Correspondent
text:
Following requests from parents, teachers and students, the last date for receipt of entries for The Hindu Young World Painting Competition, presented by Thyrocare, has been extended to March 6.

The participants should register their names inwww.thehindu.com/ ywpaintingto generate a unique registration number. The URN should be marked in the right corner of the drawing.

Details of name, class, school and location should be written in the backside of the drawing, which should be sent to the nearest office of The Hindu .

It should be attested by the head of institution or art teacher as original work. Any number of entries can be sent by a participant. While the first entry will be free, Rs.100 will be collected for every subsequent entry.

The finals will be held on March 19 and 20 in Chennai, Puducherry, Coimbatore, Madurai, Tirunelveli, Tiruchi, Salem, Hyderabad, Gulbarga, Visakhapatnam, Rajahmundry, Vijayawada, Tirupati, Bengaluru, Mangaluru, Hubbali, Thiruvananthapuram, Kochi, Kozhikode, Palghat, New Delhi, Lucknow, Mumbai, Pune and Kolkata.

Two categories

The competition will be conducted under two categories: juniors (classes IV to VI) and seniors (classes VII to IX). Students selected for the finals will be intimated about the venue, date and time.
title: Last date extended
